One of the things I like to stress about moderation action is that we aren't one big monolithic person. We have moderators of all "molds" as it were, and I think that is a good thing. Still, though some opaqueness is sometimes nescessary, I think that we try our very best (within our imperfect limits) to come to an equitable solution for all.

> 
> whats the stander procedure if someone gets into your account and start posting random stuff that is offensive (that hasnt happened to me probably wont but you never know)

It doesn't happen often enough for there to be a "standard procedure". We would handle claims of account hijacking on a case-by-case basis, and we need to make sure that it's not being used as a "misbehave and get out of jail free" card.

> 
> so you basically have to be really bad at following rules or just like to cause trouble to get banned? (green iron crown)

People are given many chances to clean up their act before we would consider banning them (except for spammers and duplicate accounts, those aren't tolerated). Rest assured that posters who have been banned have gone out of their way to earn it. Green Iron Crown was a test account/joke, not exactly the same thing.

Lots of new users with their early posts to review, lots of posts made in the wrong areas that need moving, lots of users unfamiliar with the rules and culture here that need some gentle guidance. Also lots of arguing and complaining about 1.0 itself from veterans, most of which is fine but some of which requires our attention.
